text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the lobby and leaves for work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs to his apartment on the 10th floor.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

Why does he do this? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why this man takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor on rainy days.
Let me break this down step by step.
First, the man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the lobby, which is the ground floor, I assume, and leaves for work.
So, he's going from 10th to 1st floor in the morning.
Then, in the evening, after work, he takes the elevator up to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs from there to his 10th floor apartment.
That makes sense because taking the elevator part of the way and then walking the remaining stairs would save him time compared to walking all the way up from the lobby.
But on rainy days, he changes his routine.
Instead of getting off at the 7th floor and walking up, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.
So, why would he do that on rainy days? There must be a reason related to the weather.
I'm thinking about the possible reasons.
Rain can make walking slippery, so maybe he doesn't want to walk up the stairs when it's raining.
If he takes the elevator all the way, he avoids walking on wet stairs, which could be dangerous or uncomfortable.
That makes sense because walking in the rain can be messy and potentially hazardous, especially on stairs that might be wet or slippery.
Another angle could be the time factor.
Maybe the elevator is faster, but in this case, he's already taking the elevator part of the way in the evening.
So, taking the elevator all the way would just be the same as usual but without the stairs.
But I think the primary reason is related to the weather conditions making walking less desirable.
So, putting it all together, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to avoid walking up the wet and possibly slippery stairs, which would be unsafe or uncomfortable.

</think>

The man takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor on rainy days to avoid walking up the potentially slippery stairs, ensuring he stays safe and dry.
